channel.title: Hello on Sumesh Murali

item.title: I Built a Boring Website
item.description:
I Built a Boring Website

I built QuietFeeds, and it’s boring. It aggregates links from various RSS feeds and displays them in a somewhat likable way. I knew it would be boring, yet I built it.

Why would anyone invest their time into building such an unremarkable website? That’s what this post is about — my justification for building something intentionally boring.

Why I Built It

TLDR : I quit social media, needed a calm way to keep up with topics I genuinely care about, and found myself manually checking Hacker News and other sources. So I built QuietFeeds — a simple site that pulls relevant articles from my chosen sources and shows me only what I care about.

item.title: Who Am I
item.description:
About Me

I’m a coder (unlike rest of us) with interests in Coffee, Linux and Books.

  • I write code for a living
  • I think about life a lot and likely going through existential crisis
  • I want to make a small contribution to make the world a better place (like Linus - the linux guy)

…

Ok Ok, I’m still working on it, please come back later
